front.div:
A fast convolution for one or more sparse vectors
Watch this File
File Information
Tags for This File
Comments and Ratings
Tag Activity for this File
Description OUT=SPARSECONV(X,F) efficiently computes the convolution of the (sparse) input X with the (sparse) filter F.
Speed gain can be extremely high in case both X and F are long sparse vectors.
MATLAB release MATLAB 5.3 (R11)
front.keywords: Everyone's Tags convulution, fast, linear algebra, mathematics, sparse

very well and efficiently computes the convolution finite
14 May 2006
Grant Hutchins
It works great! Cut my convolution from 20 seconds to 6 seconds for a
fairly populated sparse matrix
28 Aug 2009
Augustin Lefevre
28 Aug 2009
Augustin Lefevre
The code is correct. Bear in mind that usually Fast Convolution means
convolution computed with a Fast Fourier Transform. It is not the case with
sparseconv (FFT is impossible with sparse vectors)
30 Apr 2010
Mihail Sirotenko
Awesome! Just what I needed!
